pull.title: [0.12]  	Add backwards-compatibility issues (chainstate obfuscation) to release notes

events.body: Concept ACK. Is there a way to instruct 0.12 to not use obfuscation?

events.message: [doc] backwards-compatibility issues due to chainstate obfuscation

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -40,8 +42,17 @@ bootstrap.dat) anew afterwards. It is possible that the data from a completely
 synchronised 0.10 node may be usable in older versions as-is, but this is not
 supported and may break as soon as the older version attempts to reindex.
 
-This does not affect wallet forward or backward compatibility. There are no
-known problems when downgrading from 0.11.x to 0.10.x.
+This does not affect wallet forward or backward compatibility.
+
+# Downgrade to a version < 0.12.0
+
+Because release 0.12.0 and later will obfuscate the chainstate on every
+reindex, the block files and databases are not backwards-compatible with
+pre-0.12 versions of Bitcoin Core or other software.
+
+If you want to downgrade after you did a reindex with 0.12.0 or later,

@@ -40,8 +42,17 @@ bootstrap.dat) anew afterwards. It is possible that the data from a completely
 synchronised 0.10 node may be usable in older versions as-is, but this is not
 supported and may break as soon as the older version attempts to reindex.
 
-This does not affect wallet forward or backward compatibility. There are no
-known problems when downgrading from 0.11.x to 0.10.x.
+This does not affect wallet forward or backward compatibility.
+
+# Downgrade to a version < 0.12.0
+
+Because release 0.12.0 and later will obfuscate the chainstate on every
+reindex, the block files and databases are not backwards-compatible with
+pre-0.12 versions of Bitcoin Core or other software.
+
+If you want to downgrade after you did a reindex with 0.12.0 or later,
+you need to reindex when you first start Bitcoin Core version 0.11 or
